result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason L. Hale was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety, not be present in any bar or tavern.   Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.  Submit DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

filed by District Attorney's office

filed by defendant/counsel

1:00 Defendant Jason L. Hale in court with Attorney Leonie Dolch.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing relates to case nos:  15 CM 421 and 14 CM 427.  Victim's rights have been complied with; victim not present.  1:03 Recess to go over paperwork and victim impact statement.  1:11 Court resumed.  Court questioned defendant; defendant pled No Contest to Count 1 - Bail Jumping in 15 CM 421; factual basis is complaint; Court accepted plea, found defendant guilty, and ordered JOC.  Counsel argued sentencing; defendant made statement.  Court withheld sentence; ordered 1 year probation w/cond. - maintain absolute sobriety, not be present in any bar or tavern, AODA assessment and recommendations, DNA sample, $543 fine/costs on 14 CM 427 and $443 fine/costs on 15 CM 421. No jail credit.  1:30 Court adjourned.
Cases called: 14CM427 & 15CM421, Attorney Leonie Dolch appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Reset requested. Cases to be set for argued sentencing in Br. 1.
Plea/Sentencing 3/23/2016 1:00pm Branch 1
